newsitem.title: POLAND: MICHAEL JACKSON MAY BUILD AMUSEMENT PARK IN WARSAW.
newsitem.headline: MICHAEL JACKSON MAY BUILD AMUSEMENT PARK IN WARSAW.

text.p: Pop star Michael Jackson and the Mayor of Warsaw signed on Wednesday a preliminary letter of intent to develop a Family Entertainment Theme Park in the Polish capital.
The letter said both parties would appoint representatives who would jointly study the project and present their recommendations in 12 months.
"Following this report both parties shall meet and agree on whether to continue this project and on what terms, if any," the letter said.
Jackson, on a two-day visit to Poland, is also looking to restore a vast 300-room palace in the western town of Lubiaz to live in sometimes.
"I was six times around the world and no other country has touched me the way Poland has," Jackson, wearing a black, uniform-like tunic, hat and dark glasses said after the signing ceremony.
Warsaw Mayor Marcin Swiecicki said neither the location nor the size of the amusement park had been decided yet, but that both sides wanted it to be an all-year site for both children and adults.
"We want it to be a modern park, not just a Disneyland replica, one which would take into account the values of Polish culture and universal values," Swiecicki said.
Earlier on Wednesday Jackson met the Polish President's wife, Jolanta Kwasniewska, and discussed his Polish investment plans.
